channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report X-2023120689
item.description:
Report X-2023120689

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-08T00:36:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-10
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023120689 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD WET. CONTENTS LEAKED OUT OF THEIR CAPS. CAPS ARE DEFECTIVE. SPILL WAS MINOR. PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG. DescribePack: CAPS ARE DEFECTIVE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL WAS MINOR. PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG. 2. X-2023120693 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM LOAD SIDE WET. CONTENT'S LEAKED OUT OF THEIR CAPS. CAPS ARE DEFECTIVE. SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG. DescribePack: CAPS ARE DEFECTIVE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG. 3. X-2023120694 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM LOAD SIDE WET. CONTENTS LEAKED THROUGH THEIR CAPS. CAPS ARE DEFECTIVE. SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG. DescribePack: CAPS ARE DEFECTIVE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG.

item.title: Report X-2023120682
item.description:
Report X-2023120682

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-08T00:36:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-11
  • City: ANAHEIM
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found to be wet on the outer container while been unloaded. We placed the package in a hazmat bag and tote and took it for inspection. Upon inspection we found one of the Two bottles had a loose cap causing it to leak about 10oz on to the outer container. all clean up material was kept with package. DescribePack: One of the two bottles had a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a hazmat bag and tote.

item.title: Report X-2023120701
item.description:
Report X-2023120701

  • City: STOCKTON

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in the unload. the package handler called manger about a leaking hazmat. DescribePack: The box being taken off the belt, the package handler saw the box leaking liquid shortly after. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a tote lined with a hazardous materials bag and then taken to the HMPA for further. processing.

item.description:
Report X-2023120695

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-10
  • City: SACRAMENTO

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM LOAD SIDE GIVING OFF A STRONG GAS ODOR. CONTENT'S CAP IS CROSS THREADED ALLOWING MINOR LEAKAGE. PKG WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG AND BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE. DescribePack: CONTENT'S CAP IS CROSS THREADED ALLOWING MINOR LEAKAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG AND BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE.

item.title: Report X-2023120659
item.description:
Report X-2023120659

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-08T00:36:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD TRAILER 310460 WET. PACKAGE DAMAGED DURING TRANSIT. ALL BOTTLES HAD CAPS LESS THAN FINGERTIGHT. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE LEAKED FROM LOOSE CAP AND CHEMICALLY DETERIORATED SEAL. NONHAZMAT PACKAGE 717881331177 SOILED AND UNUSABLE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL NEUTRALIZED AND COLLECTED WITH PHNINE AND BROOM. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: AT THE MOMENT THE PCKAGE HANDLER TRIED TO PLACE THE PACKAGE IN THE BELT HE ACCIDENTALLY DROPPED IT. DescribePack: THERE WAS NOT ENOUGH INNER PACKAGING TO SUPPORT A FALL DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT TOTE INSIDE A BAG TO PREVENT SPILLING AND IT WAS PROSSECED ACCORDINGLY TO THE DISPOSITION

  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO THE PRELOAD TO A REPORT OF A PACKAGE HAVING A STRONG SMELL. UPON DISCOVERING THE PACKAGE W/HAZARDOUS MATERIAL SHIPPING PAPERS AND DISPLAYING AN OXIDIZER 5.1 DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL, RESPONDER DONNED THE APPROPIATE PPE AS OUTLINED IN THE DECISION TREE RESPONSE BOOKLET.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When it was discovered that the package was leaking liquid, it was removed from the conveyor belt and placed in a Hazmat tote so it could be inspected. DescribePack: The package was damaged because when it was placed on the conveyor it was dropped, causing the paint cans to be damaged and paint to be spilled. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed inside a Hazmat tote to prevent further spillage and later placed inside a Hazmat Bag to be processed according to the Disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023120210
item.description:
Report X-2023120210

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-08T00:36:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: BARSTOW
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 11/22/23, the UTLX 205951 was found in the Barstow railyard to be leaking methanol from the top of the car. Hazmat responders isolated the car and the inspection revealed liquid leaking through the packing stem. The valve was found in the partially open position and was missing the packing retainer nut. The valve and release were secured with a pin. On 11/30/23, Graymar Env returned to further secure the valve by adding a packing sleeve and retainer nut. The car was pressure tested to verify integrity of repairs. No leaks were found. Shipper advised of need to get OTMA for movement to destination.
